alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 24 at 12:47PM EDT until June 24 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Delaware County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 1247 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Chester, Yeadon, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Jenkintown, Narberth, National Park, East Lansdowne, Rockledge, Abington, and Bryn Athyn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 4 and 17...and between mile markers 21 and 22...and between mile markers 31 and 33. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 335 and 350. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 11. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
